what: Candidates’ selection for a pool of donors
title: Candidate's selection
text: can also simulate selection wait list candidates pool donors, according given model (algorithm). function donor_recipient_pairs() allow us compute possible donor-recipient pairs according previously described kidney allocation algorithms. example use pool 70 donors (donors data frame available package) select wait list 500 transplant candidates (data frame also available package) Now can also compute new column estimated 5-year event (mortality graft failure) probability described Molnar et al.1 available application TxScore, function txscore():
code: # compute all possible donor-recipient pairs for each one of the donors according to ‘lima’ algorithm all_pairs <- donor_recipient_pairs(df.donors = donors,                       df.candidates = candidates,                       df.abs = cabs,                       algorithm = lima,                       n = 0,                       check.validity = FALSE)  # for loop to select 2 available candidates for a pool of donors used.candidates <- NULL result <- NULL for(i in 1: length(all_pairs)){   tmp <- all_pairs[[i]][!ID %in% used.candidates][1:2,]    result <- data.table::rbindlist(list(result, tmp))   used.candidates <- c(used.candidates, tmp$ID) }  # as a result we have all the selected donor-recipient pairs for a given pool of donors result #>       ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #>   1:  81  A  2 23 15 49  15   4   1   1    1     3  44        46       91    0 #>   2: 243  A  2 24  7 49   4   4   1   1    1     3  22        46       73    0 #>   3: 317  O  1 68 51 58  13   9   1   2    2     5  31        55      113    0 #>   4: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   2   2    2     6  58        55      104    0 #>   5: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   2   1    2     5  55        32      103    0 #>  ---                                                                           #> 136: 234  O  3 29  7 51  11   4   2   1    0     3  54        53       65    0 #> 137: 184  O  2 30 27 58  13   8   1   1    1     3  56        44       68    0 #> 138: 447  O  2 24 15 35  11   7   0   2    1     3  33        44       48   50 #> 139: 388  A  2 24 15 44  13   4   0   0    0     0  53        58       33   14 #> 140:   1  A  2 24 15 44   1   4   0   0    1     1  53        58       59    0 #>         HI     cp SP #>   1: FALSE Yellow  2 #>   2: FALSE Yellow  2 #>   3: FALSE Orange  2 #>   4: FALSE Orange  2 #>   5: FALSE Orange  2 #>  ---                 #> 136: FALSE Yellow  2 #> 137: FALSE Yellow  2 #> 138: FALSE Yellow  2 #> 139: FALSE  Green  2 #> 140: FALSE  Green  2 result[!is.na(ID),][ ,                      txs := txscore(recipient.age = age,                                     recipient.dialysis = dialysis,                                     donor.age = donor_age,                                     mmHLA_A = mmA,                                     mmHLA_B = mmB,                                     mmHLA_DR = mmDR)$prob5y,                      by = 'ID'][]  #>       ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #>   1:  81  A  2 23 15 49  15   4   1   1    1     3  44        46       91    0 #>   2: 243  A  2 24  7 49   4   4   1   1    1     3  22        46       73    0 #>   3: 317  O  1 68 51 58  13   9   1   2    2     5  31        55      113    0 #>   4: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   2   2    2     6  58        55      104    0 #>   5: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   2   1    2     5  55        32      103    0 #>  ---                                                                           #> 135: 234  O  3 29  7 51  11   4   2   1    0     3  54        53       65    0 #> 136: 184  O  2 30 27 58  13   8   1   1    1     3  56        44       68 4   0   0    1     1  53        58       59    0 #>         HI     cp SP   txs #>   1: FALSE Yellow  2 58.43 #>   2: FALSE Yellow  2 64.40 #>   3: FALSE Orange  2 65.77 #>   4: FALSE Orange  2 62.42 #>   5: FALSE Orange  2 57.87 #>  ---                       #> 135: FALSE Yellow  2 62.45 #> 136: FALSE Yellow  2 60.66 #> 137: FALSE Yellow  2 56.24 #> 138: FALSE  Green  2 48.87 #> 139: FALSE  Green title: Candidate's selection
text: Input data used package’s functions, regarding either candidates donors information, provided user must exact format example data available. Also, {simK} package allows generate synthetic data candidates donors can used {histoc}.

title: How to use
text: default 2 candidates selected donor, although can define number candidates selected. Portuguese rules allocation kidneys deceased donor (PT model) based scoring system takes consideration: HLA mismatches donor transplant candidate, level immunization candidate, time dialysis, age difference donor transplant candidate. Total scores donor-recipient pairs given column ptsPT. Also, hipersensitized candidates (hiper()) (cPRA >85%) HI prioritized candidates ordered corresponding score.
code: pts() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   1   1    1     3  58        65      104    0 #> 2: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   1   1    2     4  55        65      103    0 #>       HI ptsPT SP ptsHLA ptsPRA ptsage ptsdial #> 1: FALSE  16.4  3      2      0      4    10.4 #> 2: FALSE  15.3  3      1      0      4    10.3

title: How to use
text: simplified version EuroTransplant Kidney Allocation System (ETKAS)4 first time kidney candidates 18 years old donated one kidneys can simulated et(). simulation donor, transplant candidates sorted : Senior Program (65+ years old candidates donor 65+ years) SP; Acceptable Mismatch Program (candidates cPRA >85% without HLA antibodies HLA’s donor) ; 000 HLA mismatches (candidates without HLA mismatches donor) mmHLA; ETKAS points pointsET. Final points eligible candidate obtained sum HLA points (et_mmHLA()), dialysis (et_dialysis()) points MMP points (et_mmp()).
code: et() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 442  A  3 25  7 15  13   4   2   1    1     4  68        65       98    0 #> 2: 344  A  1  3 35 49   1   4   1   2    0     3  70        65       69    0 #>       HI pointsET SP AM #> 1: FALSE       98  1  0 #> 2: FALSE       69  1  0

title: How to use
text: United Kingdom (UK) deceased donor kidney allocation transplantation firstly based definition two ranked Tiers candidates eligible donor (Tier): Tier – patients match score = 10 cPRA = 100% time dialysis >7 years; Tier B – eligible patients. Within Tier , transplant candidates ordered matchability time dialysis. Transplant candidates within Tier B prioritized according point-based system computed 7 elements: Matchability (matchability) Time dialysis (dialysis) Donor-recipient risk index combinations (ric()) HLA match age combined (age mmHLA) Donor-recipient age difference (age donor_age) Total HLA mismatch (mmHLa) Blood group match (abo_uk()) function simulates allocation kidneys candidates’ waiting list kidney-transplants take consideration geographical criteria.
code: uk() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 matchability mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age #> 1: 324  O  1 11  8 35   3  13       1745.9   1   2    2     5  69        65 #> 2: 104  O  2  3  8 27   3   3       1745.9   1   2    2     5  45        65 #>    dialysis cPRA Tier pointsUK #> 1:       81    0    A     9999 #> 2:       66    0    A     9999

title: How to use
text: Within model, color prioritization (cp()) waiting list transplant candidates established. Transplant candidates classified according clinical urgency (red color), regarding time dialysis cPRA value cPRA. orange color marked patients cPRA >85% time dialysis higher waiting time 3rd quartile. yellow classified patients cPRA >50% time dialysis higher waiting time median. , green classified rest. Within color group candidates ordered mmHLA (ascendant) time dialisys (descendant). Also, candidates allocated donors within age group (old old program) (SP), mimicking EuroTransplant senior program (sp()).
code: lima() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   1   1    1     3  58        60      104    0 #> 2: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   1   1    2     4  55        60      103    0 #>       HI     cp SP #> 1: FALSE Orange  2 #> 2: FALSE Orange  2

title: Histocompatibility functions for organ transplantation
text: License: Creative Commons Attribution CC-. Feel free share adapt, don’t forget credit authors. 🎯 package histocompatibility analysis performed kidney allocation systems transplantation. can see histoc action, . histoc provides functions compatibility organ donors transplant candidates, allowing simulate different kidney allocation systems transplantation. ⚠️ package medical device used making clinical decisions.

title: Candidates' Color Priority — cp
text: data data frame information candidates' waiting list. q2 numerical value median candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). q3 numerical value third quartile candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). cPRA1 numerical value (100 - 100) lower cPRA cutoff. cPRA2 numerical value (100 - 100) higher cPRA cutoff. cPRA2 must greater cPRA1.

title: ET algorithm — et
text: iso logical value isogroupal compatibility. dABO character value ABO blood group (O, , B, AB). dA donor's HLA-typing. dB donor's HLA-B typing. dDR donor's HLA-DR typing. donor.age numeric value donor's age. data data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant candidates. month numeric value punctuation month (env$month.points.minimum env$month.points.maximum) mm0 numeric value points 0 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm1 numeric value points 1 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm2 numeric value points 2 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm3 numeric value points 3 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm4 numeric value points 4 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm5 numeric value points 5 HLA mm ETKAS points table mm6 numeric value points 6 HLA mm ETKAS points table df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. hlaA data frame HLA-allele frequencies hlaB data frame HLA-B allele frequencies hlaDR data frame HLA-DR allele frequencies abo_freq data frame ABO blood group frequencies n positive integer slice first candidates. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input.

title: Mismatch Probability (MMP) from ETKAS — et_mmp
text: Mismatch Probability (MMP) calculation probability receiving kidney offer 0 1 broad HLA-, -B split DR mismatches based 1000 kidneys offered, taking account AB0 blood group rules PRA screening. Patients receive 0-100 MMPs

code: et_mmp(   data = candidates,   hlaA = hlaApt,   hlaB = hlaBpt,   hlaDR = hlaDRpt,   abo_freq = ABOpt,   check.validity = TRUE )

title: Lima's algorithm — lima
text: iso logical value isogroupal compatibility. dABO character value ABO blood group (O, , B, AB). dA donor's HLA-typing. dB donor's HLA-B typing. dDR donor's HLA-DR typing. donor.age numeric value donor's age. df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. data data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant candidates color priority classification. n positive integer slice first candidates. q2 numerical value median candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). q3 numerical value third quartile candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). cPRA1 numerical value (0 - 100) lower cPRA cutoff. cPRA2 numerical value (0 - 100) higher cPRA cutoff. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input.

text: ordered data frame column cp (color priority), 'sp', 'hi' 'mmHLA'.

title: Lima's algorithm — lima
code: lima(iso = TRUE, dABO = "O", dA = c("1","2"), dB = c("15","44"), dDR = c("1","4"), donor.age = 60, df.abs = cabs, data = candidates, n = 2, check.validity = TRUE) #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   1   1    1     3  58        60      104    0 #> 2: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   1   1    2     4  55        60      103    0 #>       HI     cp SP #> 1: FALSE Orange  2 #> 2: FALSE Orange  2

title: number of HLA mismatchs — mmHLA
text: Computes number HLA mismatchs donor candidate

title: number of HLA mismatchs — mmHLA
text: dA donor's HLA-typing dB donor's HLA-B typing dDR donor's HLA-DR typing cA candidate's HLA-typing cB candidate's HLA-B typing cDR candidate's HLA-DR typing

title: number of HLA mismatchs — mmHLA
text: mmA number HLA-mismatchs dA cA; mmB number HLA-B mismatchs dB cB; mmDR number HLA-DR mismatchs dADRand cDR; mmHLA sum mmA + mmB + mmDR

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: PT algorithm — pts
text: Applies PT algorithm deceased donor's Kidney allocation transplantation. Ordering waitlisted candidates given donor according PT's algorithm.

title: PT algorithm — pts
code: pts(   iso = TRUE,   dABO = "O",   dA = c("1", "2"),   dB = c("15", "44"),   dDR = c("1", "4"),   donor.age = 65,   df.abs = cabs,   data = candidates,   points.80 = 8,   points.50 = 4,   points.dialysis = 0.1,   points.age = 4,   n = 2,   check.validity = TRUE )

title: PT algorithm — pts
text: iso logical value isogroup compatibility. dABO character value ABO blood group (O, , B, AB). dA donor's HLA-typing. dB donor's HLA-B typing. dDR donor's HLA-DR typing. donor.age numeric value donor's age. df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. data data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant candidates color priority classification. points.80 numerical value (0 - 20) points cPRA >= 80 points.50 numerical value (0 - 20) points cPRA >= 50 points.dialysis punctuaction month dialysis points.age numerical value points age difference n positive integer slice first candidates. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input.

title: PT algorithm — pts
text: ordered data frame column cp (color priority), sp, hi mmHLA.

title: PT algorithm — pts
code: pts(iso = TRUE, dABO = "A", dA = c("1","2"), dB = c("15","44"), dDR = c("1","4"), donor.age = 65,  data = candidates, df.abs = cabs, n = 2) #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 442  A  3 25  7 15  13   4   2   1    1     4  68        65       98    0 #> 2:   1  A  2 24 15 44   1   4   1   0    0     1  53        65       59    0 #>       HI ptsPT SP ptsHLA ptsPRA ptsage ptsdial #> 1: FALSE  15.8  1      2      0      4     9.8 #> 2: FALSE  13.9  3      8      0      0     5.9

title: Points for HLA mismatches — pts_HLA

title: Points for HLA mismatches — pts_HLA

title: Points for HLA mismatches — pts_HLA
text: itemA Points HLA fullmatch (mm HLA-, B DR) itemB Points without mm HLA-B DR itemC Points 1 mm HLA-B DR itemD Points 1 mm HLA-B 1 mm DR itemE Points remaing possibilities mm.Number HLA-mismatchs(0 2) mm.B Number HLA-B mismatchs(0 2) mm.DR Number HLA-DR mismatchs(0 2)

title: Points for HLA mismatches — pts_HLA
text: numerical value pre-defined points

what: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
title: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
text: Generic function runs matchability combinations donors candidates. Runs arbitrary number times (iteration.number) provide statistics.

title: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
code: several(   iteration.number = 10,   df.donors = donors,   df.candidates = candidates,   df.abs = cabs,   algorithm = lima,   n = 0,   seed.number = 123,   check.validity = TRUE,   ... )

title: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
text: iteration.number Number times matchability runs. df.donors data frame containing demographics medical information poll donors. uk algorithm must respective columns. df.candidates data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant candidates. uk algorithm must respective columns. df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. algorithm name function use. Valid options : lima, et, pts, uk (without quotation) n positive integer slice first candidates. seed.number Seed new random number. seed.number can NA case seed applied. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input. ... parameters used function algorithm

title: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
text: Statistics related times function ran.

title: Runs several time the function donor_recipient_pairs() as bootstrap. — several
code: if (FALSE) { several(iteration.number = 10, df.donors = donors, df.candidates = candidates, df.abs = cabs, algorithm = lima, n = 0, seed.number = 123, check.validity = TRUE) }

title: Senior Program classification — sp
text: Returns 1 candidates' belongs Senior Program. Prioritization older patients older donors, followed young patients younger donors, last remaining patients.

title: Senior Program classification — sp
text: donor.age numeric value donor's age candidate.age numeric value candidate's age

title: Senior Program classification — sp
text: value 1 candidates older 65 also donor older 65

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
text: Returns estimated 5-year event (mortality graft failure combined outcome) probability described Molnar, el al (2017).

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
code: txscore(   recipient.age = 20,   recipient.race = "White",   recipient.causeESRD = "Other",   recipient.dialysis = 12,   recipient.diabetes = FALSE,   recipient.coronary = FALSE,   recipient.albumin = 1.5,   recipient.hemoglobin = 10,   donor.age = 30,   donor.diabetes = "Absence",   donor.ECD = FALSE,   mmHLA_A = 0,   mmHLA_B = 0,   mmHLA_DR = 0 )

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
text: https://balima.shinyapps.io/scoreTx/

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
text: recipient.age numeric value recipient's age recipient.race character value recipient's race options: 'White', 'Black', 'Hispanic', '' recipient.causeESRD numeric value recipient's cause End-Stage Renal Disease, options: '', 'Diabetes', 'Hypertension', 'Glomerulonephritis', 'Cystic disease' recipient.dialysis numeric value recipient's time dialysis (months) recipient.diabetes logical value recipient's diabetic status recipient.coronary logical value recipient's coronary artery disease status recipient.albumin numeric value recipient's albumin (g/dL) recipient.hemoglobin numeric value recipient's hemoglobin (g/dL) donor.age numeric value donor's age donor.diabetes logical value donor's diabetic status, options: 'Absence', 'Presence', 'Unknown' donor.ECD logical value regarding Extended Criteria Donor mmHLA_A numeric value (0, 1, 2) number HLA-mismatchs mmHLA_B numeric value (0, 1, 2) number HLA-B mismatchs mmHLA_DR numeric value (0, 1, 2) number HLA-DR mismatchs

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
text: 5 year probability combined outcome mortality graft failure

title: TRANSPLANTSCORE (Tx Score) — txscore
code: txscore(recipient.age = 20, recipient.race = "White", #insurance = 0, recipient.causeESRD = "Other", recipient.dialysis = 12, recipient.diabetes = FALSE, recipient.coronary = FALSE, recipient.albumin = 1.5, recipient.hemoglobin = 10, donor.age = 30, donor.diabetes = "Absence", donor.ECD = FALSE, #mmHLA = "0", mmHLA_A = 0, mmHLA_B = 0, mmHLA_DR = 0) #> $LP #> [1] 0.87003 #>  #> $gamma #> [1] 0.916 #>  #> $PS #> [1] 0.7969475 #>  #> $prob5y #> [1] 46.82 #>

title: UK algorithm — uk
text: Applies UK algorithm deceased donor's Kidney allocation transplantation. Ordering waitlisted candidates given donor according UK transplant algorithm.

title: UK algorithm — uk
text: DRI Donor RisK Index group (D1, D2, D3, D4) dA donor's HLA-typing. dB donor's HLA-B typing. dDR donor's HLA-DR typing. dABO character value ABO blood group (O, , B, AB). donor.age numeric value donor's age. data data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant UK transplant. D1R1 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D1R2 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D1R3 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D1R4 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D2R1 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D2R2 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D2R3 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D2R4 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D3R1 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D3R2 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D3R3 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D3R4 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D4R1 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D4R2 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D4R3 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj D4R4 numeric value (0 - 1000) combination indexes DiRj ptsDial numeric value points corresponding month dialysis a1 numeric value HLA match age combined formula: b1*cos(age / env$adulthood.age)+a1 a2 numeric value HLA match age combined formula: b2*cos(age / env$adulthood.age)+a2 b1 numeric value HLA match age combined formula: b1*cos(age / env$adulthood.age)+a1 b2 numeric value HLA match age combined formula: b2*cos(age / env$adulthood.age)+a2 b3 numeric value HLA match age combined formula: b3*sin(age / 50) m numeric value matchability formula: m * (1 + (MS / nn) ^ o) nn numeric value matchability formula: m * (1 + (MS / nn) ^ o) o numeric value matchability formula: m * (1 + (MS / nn) ^ o) mm1 numeric value penalize 1 mm mm23 numeric value penalize 2-3 mm mm46 numeric value penalize 4-6 mm pts negative value penalization B candidates df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. n positive integer slice first candidates. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input.

title: virtual crossmatch (XM) — xmatch
text: returns candidates' virtual crossmatch againts donor's HLA typing

title: virtual crossmatch (XM) — xmatch
code: xmatch(   dA = c("1", "2"),   dB = c("5", "7"),   dDR = c("1", "4"),   df.abs = cabs,   check.validity = TRUE )

title: virtual crossmatch (XM) — xmatch
text: dA donor's HLA-typing dB donor's HLA-B typing dDR donor's HLA-DR typing df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies check.validity Logical decide whether validate input.

text: dataframe candidates' ID xm result POS/NEG
